list.title: Implementation of ISO 27001 ISMS in an industrial group
list.summary: We supported a holding company with operations in Chile and Peru in implementing and certifying ISO 27001, strengthening its information security management in record time.
list.description: Cyberhub guided a holding company with presence in Chile and Peru through the full implementation of an Information Security Management System (ISMS), achieving ISO 27001 certification in less than 9 months.
list.content:
Transforming information security in an industrial group

Cyberhub led the implementation of an Information Security Management System (ISMS) based on the ISO/IEC 27001:2022 standard for a holding company operating in Chile and Peru. The project aimed to strengthen data protection processes and foster an organizational security culture.

Initial challenge

The organization was undergoing rapid growth and needed to standardize its security controls for audits and regulatory requirements. It had multiple business units with different levels of security maturity and fragmented documentation.

Approach and methodology

  • Initial maturity diagnosis based on ISO 27001 Gap Assessment.
  • Risk identification and treatment according to ISO 27005.
  • Design and implementation of technical and organizational policies, procedures, and controls.
  • Training for over 200 employees on information security best practices.
  • Internal audit simulations to validate readiness before certification.

Results achieved

In less than 9 months, the holding company achieved ISO 27001 certification at a corporate level, strengthening its position with international clients and improving operational efficiency. Security incidents were reduced by 45%, and a permanent security committee was established.

“Cyberhub’s support was key in aligning our security strategy with business objectives. Today we have a mature, sustainable, and certified ISMS.”
— IT Manager, Industrial Group

Lessons learned

The project demonstrated that building an effective ISMS requires both executive commitment and active participation from operational areas. Integration between technology, processes, and people was essential for success.

Want to certify your organization under ISO 27001? Contact us →

list.title: Gap assessment and compliance with Law 21.633 (OIV)
list.summary: We identified compliance gaps with Law 21.633 for an energy company, developing an action plan based on the NIST CSF framework and governance best practices.
list.description: We helped an energy sector company identify its compliance gaps regarding Law 21.633 requirements and develop its action plan based on the NIST CSF framework.
list.content:
Compliance assessment with Law 21.633 in an energy company

A Chilean energy company engaged Cyberhub to evaluate its level of compliance with Law 21.633, which regulates Organizations of Vital Importance (OIV). The goal was to establish a clear diagnosis and an action plan to reach the level of maturity required by authorities.

Context and challenge

The company needed to align with new legal requirements on cybersecurity and operational continuity. However, it lacked a structured reference framework to evaluate readiness against Government CSIRT guidelines.

Applied methodology

  • Information gathering through interviews and document review.
  • Maturity assessment using the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF).
  • Gap identification against the controls required by Law 21.633 and its technical guidelines.
  • Design of a prioritized action plan with defined milestones and responsibilities.
  • Delivery of executive and technical reports with a clear compliance roadmap.

Results achieved

The assessment enabled the organization to understand its real maturity level in Risk Management, Critical Asset Protection, and Incident Response. A structured improvement plan in three phases was created and is currently under execution with quarterly oversight by the Corporate Security Committee.

“Thanks to Cyberhub’s guidance, we translated legal requirements into concrete actions, improving visibility and management of our operational risks.”
— CISO, Energy Company

Next steps

Based on the results, the company began implementing the NIST CSF Framework as the foundation for its corporate cybersecurity management system and strengthened its internal audit capabilities.

Request a compliance assessment for your organization →

list.title: Technical audit and IT security training
list.summary: We conducted a comprehensive IT security audit for a financial institution, complemented by customized training to enhance team resilience.
list.description: We performed a full security audit of a financial institution’s IT infrastructure, accompanied by tailored training sessions for technical and executive teams.
list.content:
Technical audit and cybersecurity capability building

A national financial institution hired Cyberhub to perform a comprehensive audit of its technological infrastructure and provide security training to its technical and executive teams.

Initial situation

The organization aimed to identify critical vulnerabilities in its IT environment and improve its internal cybersecurity culture. It had no continuous review process or formal training program.

Project stages

  • Review of security architecture and policies.
  • Penetration testing and vulnerability analysis.
  • Control evaluation for servers, networks, and endpoints.
  • Development of a prioritized mitigation plan based on risk level.
  • Delivery of technical workshops and executive awareness sessions.

Main findings and improvements

Significant gaps were identified in patch management, identity and access control, and network segmentation. After implementing the action plan, the institution achieved a 60% reduction in critical vulnerabilities and established a quarterly review schedule.

“The audit allowed us to understand our real exposure and prioritize cybersecurity investments. The training transformed how our teams approach security.”
— IT Operations Manager, Financial Institution

Final impact

Beyond raising technical maturity, the project helped build a sustainable culture of cyber resilience, supported by performance metrics and automated internal tracking.

Schedule an IT security audit with our specialists →

list.title: Incident management and cyberattack response plan
list.summary: We developed a comprehensive incident management plan for a healthcare organization, establishing clear response protocols and roles against cyberattacks.
list.description: Cyberhub supported a healthcare organization in developing its incident response plan, defining clear protocols and roles for handling critical threats.
list.content:
Strengthening cyberattack response capabilities in the healthcare sector

Cyberhub partnered with a healthcare organization to design and implement an Information Security Incident Response Plan (ISIRP). The objective was to establish a clear, operational strategy against cyber threats that could compromise availability and confidentiality of clinical data.

Initial situation

The institution had experienced security incidents that disrupted critical medical systems and patient records. There were no formal procedures or defined roles for incident response, resulting in delayed reaction times and reliance on third parties.

Methodology and approach

  • Initial diagnosis of incident management maturity.
  • Design of the response workflow based on NIST 800-61r2 (Computer Security Incident Handling Guide).
  • Definition of roles and responsibilities within the Internal CSIRT.
  • Implementation of a centralized event logging and monitoring system.
  • Incident simulation exercises to validate reaction times and communication flow.

Results and benefits

The organization reduced its detection and containment times for critical incidents by over 50%. Standardized procedures and automated escalation rules were implemented. The response plan was aligned with business continuity and cyber resilience strategies.

“We now have a clear structure to respond to any cyberattack. Cyberhub’s preparation and support made a significant difference in our response capability.”
— Technology Director, Healthcare Organization

Key lessons

The experience highlighted that organizational preparedness and effective internal communication are essential for successful incident management. Technology alone is not enough—people were a critical component of the response.

Next steps

The plan includes biannual simulations and the adoption of a SIEM platform to improve threat detection. Cyberhub continues to support the organization in continuous process improvement.

Strengthen your organization’s incident response capabilities →

list.title: ISO/IEC 27001:2022
list.description: Information security management based on international standards.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 27001:2022 is the most recognized international standard for implementing an Information Security Management System (ISMS). Its goal is to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information using a risk-based approach.

Objective

Establish a formal and comprehensive framework for managing information security risks and protecting digital assets.

Scope

Applicable to any organization handling sensitive information, including financial institutions, technology companies, healthcare, and critical service providers.

Implementation Time

4 to 6 months depending on organizational maturity and structure.

Cyberhub Proposal

  • Gap Analysis.
  • ISMS Implementation.
  • Internal auditing.
  • Training and awareness programs.
  • Management of certifying bodies.
  • Post external audit support.
  • Integration with other ISO systems.

list.title: ISO/IEC 20000-1
list.description: IT Service Management focused on quality, efficiency, and continuous improvement.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 20000-1 defines the requirements for an effective IT Service Management System (SMS), aimed at ensuring high-quality, reliable, and business-aligned IT services.

Objective

  • Deliver reliable IT services aligned with business needs.
  • Improve operational efficiency through standardization.
  • Enhance customer satisfaction and service quality.

Scope

Applicable to IT departments, service providers, outsourcing companies, and cloud-based service operators.

Implementation Time

2 to 6 months depending on service complexity.

Cyberhub Proposal

  • Gap Analysis.
  • SMS implementation.
  • Internal audit.
  • Training and continuous improvement plans.
  • Certification body coordination.
  • Integration with ISO/IEC 27001.

list.title: ISO/IEC 42001
list.description: Responsible and secure management of Artificial Intelligence systems.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 42001 is the first international standard for implementing an Artificial Intelligence Management System (AIMS), ensuring safe, transparent, and ethical use of AI technologies.

Objective

Ensure responsible, ethical, and secure AI development, deployment, and governance.

Scope

Ideal for technology companies, AI-driven startups, research institutions, and organizations using AI in critical processes.

Implementation Time

Approximately 6 months.

Cyberhub Proposal

  • Gap Analysis and planning.
  • Design of ethical AI policies and controls.
  • AIMS implementation.
  • Internal audit and findings management.
  • Preparation for external certification.

list.title: ISO/IEC 37301
list.description: Compliance Management System promoting corporate integrity.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 37301 defines the requirements for a Compliance Management System (CMS) that reinforces ethics, transparency, and organizational integrity.

Objective

Prevent, detect, and manage legal and regulatory risks effectively.

Scope

Applicable to organizations of all sizes and industries.

Cyberhub Proposal

We implement the CMS comprehensively and prepare your organization for certification.

list.title: TISAX
list.description: Information security assessment for the automotive industry.
list.content:
TISAX is a European information security assessment model for the automotive industry, aligned with ISO/IEC 27001 and focused on protecting confidential information and prototypes.

Objective

Protect sensitive data, prototypes, and intellectual property throughout the automotive supply chain.

Scope

Designed for manufacturers, Tier 1 and Tier 2 suppliers, engineering companies, and automotive design firms.

Implementation Time

3 to 6 months.

Cyberhub Proposal

We deliver full preparation and execution for TISAX assessment and certification.

list.title: NERC-CIP
list.description: Cybersecurity requirements for critical electrical infrastructure.
list.content:
NERC-CIP establishes compulsory cybersecurity controls for critical power infrastructure to ensure secure operations across the electric grid.

Objective

Protect generation, transmission, and distribution assets from cyber threats.

Scope

Applies to entities operating within the National Electric System (SEN), based on impact level.

Implementation Time

1 month of evidence collection + 2 to 6 months of control implementation.

Cyberhub Proposal

We support evaluation, implementation, and preparation of evidence required by regulatory authorities.

list.title: NIS2
list.description: European directive for strengthening cybersecurity across essential sectors.
list.content:
NIS2 reinforces cybersecurity risk management and incident reporting obligations for essential and important entities within the European Union.

Objective

Drive digital resilience and ensure unified cybersecurity standards across member states.

Scope

Applicable to organizations operating in EU markets, including energy, healthcare, transport, water, banking, and digital services.

Implementation Time

6 to 12 months.

Cyberhub Proposal

We support end-to-end NIS2 projects for international organizations, including Gap Assessments and combined frameworks.

list.title: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
list.description: Framework for managing and reducing cybersecurity risks.
list.content:
NIST CSF provides a structured approach to cybersecurity risk management through five core functions: Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, and Recover.

Objective

Strengthen digital resilience and improve risk governance across industries.

Scope

Suitable for public and private organizations of any size or sector.

Implementation Time

6 to 12 months, depending on organizational complexity.

Cyberhub Proposal

We offer flexible implementation, combining NIST CSF with ISO/IEC 27001 and COBIT where applicable.

list.title: Cybersecurity Law
list.description: Obligations and alignment for Vital Importance Organizations (OIV).
list.content:
Chile’s Law 21.663 on Cybersecurity establishes legal obligations for Vital Importance Organizations (OIV) and entities operating essential services.

Objective

Ensure operational resilience, mandatory incident reporting, and protection of national critical infrastructure.

list.title: Data Protection Law

privacyPolicy.title: Data Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: At Cyberhub, we value and respect your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, protect, and share the personal information you provide through our website and services.

sections.heading: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: We collect personal information that you provide directly to us, such as your name, email, phone number, or other data necessary to deliver our services or respond to your inquiries.

sections.heading: 2. Use of Information
sections.content: We use the collected information for the following purposes:
list: Respond to your requests or inquiries.
Send relevant communications about our services or events.
Comply with legal or regulatory obligations.

sections.heading: 3. Data Protection
sections.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against loss, unauthorized access, alteration, or disclosure. Only authorized personnel may access this information.

sections.heading: 4. Data Sharing
sections.content: We do not share your personal data with third parties unless:
list: It is necessary to provide the requested service.
There is a legal obligation to do so.

sections.heading: 5. Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to access, rectify, delete, or restrict the processing of your personal data. You can exercise these rights by writing to contacto@cybertower.cl.

sections.heading: 6. Data Retention
sections.content: We will retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected or as required by law.

sections.heading: 7. Changes to This Policy
sections.content: Cyberhub reserves the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time. Updates will be published on this page along with their effective date.

sections.heading: 8. Contact
sections.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or about the use of your personal data, please contact us at contacto@cybertower.cl.
